p: The reconstruction of the minimum temperature change in the phylogeny using current or estimated LGM temperatures were almost indistinguishable ( Fig. 3), with a difference between 4.4–5.5 °C. This difference was not homogeneously distributed through the phylogeny, with the species under warmer current conditions having experienced a narrower historical range of temperature change ( Supplementary Fig. S3). Only 19 localities of 7 different species were estimated to have been at average below zero temperatures during the LGM ( Supplementary Table S2). All but three of these 7 species are known from additional close localities estimated to have been above zero during the LGM.
